name: Apple
description: Apples are among the world's most popular fruits. They grow on the apple tree (Malus domestica), originating in Central Asia. Apples are high in fiber, vitamin C, and various antioxidants. They are also very fulfilling, considering their low calorie content. Studies show that eating apples can have multiple benefits for your health. Apples are also great for baking, making juices, and adding flavor to various dishes.
offer: Buy 2 kg, get 1 kg free

name: Rice
description: Rice is the seed of the grass species Oryza sativa (Asian rice) or Oryza glaberrima (African rice). As a cereal grain, it is the most widely consumed staple food for a large part of the world's human population, especially in Asia and Africa. It is the agricultural commodity with the third-highest worldwide production, after sugarcane and maize. Rice can be used in a variety of dishes, from savory to sweet, and is a versatile staple in many cuisines around the world.

name: Milk
description: Milk is a nutrient-rich liquid food produced by the mammary glands of mammals. It is the primary source of nutrition for young mammals, including breastfed human infants before they are able to digest solid food. Early-lactation milk is called colostrum, which contains antibodies that strengthen the immune system and thus reduces the risk of many diseases. Milk contains a variety of nutrients including calcium, protein, vitamin D, and potassium, making it an essential part of a balanced diet.
offer: 10% off on purchase of 5 liters or more

name: Banana
description: Bananas are elongated, edible fruits produced by several kinds of large herbaceous flowering plants in the genus Musa. Bananas are high in several vitamins and minerals, especially potassium, vitamin B6, and vitamin C. They are also a good source of dietary fiber. Bananas are one of the most widely consumed fruits in the world and are known for their convenience, natural packaging, and sweet taste.

name: Bread
description: Bread is a staple food prepared from a dough of flour and water, usually by baking. Throughout recorded history, it has been a prominent food in large parts of the world and is one of the oldest man-made foods, having been of significant importance since the dawn of agriculture. Bread provides carbohydrates for energy, as well as some protein, vitamins, and minerals. It is a versatile food that can be eaten on its own or used as a base for sandwiches and other dishes.
offer: Buy 2 loaves, get 1 loaf free

name: Eggs
description: Eggs are laid by female animals of many different species, including birds, reptiles, amphibians, and fish. Eggs have been eaten by humans for thousands of years. They are a good source of high-quality protein, vitamins, and minerals. Eggs are incredibly versatile and can be cooked in many different ways, including boiling, frying, scrambling, and baking. They are used in a wide variety of dishes, both sweet and savory.

name: Tomato
description: Tomatoes are the edible berries of the plant Solanum lycopersicum, commonly known as a tomato plant. They are a rich source of vitamins, minerals, and antioxidants. Tomatoes are highly versatile and can be eaten raw in salads, sandwiches, and salsas, or cooked in sauces, soups, and stews. They are a key ingredient in many cuisines around the world and are prized for their sweet, tangy flavor.
offer: 20% off on purchase of 2 kg or more

name: Potato
description: Potatoes are tuberous crops from the perennial nightshade Solanum tuberosum. They are the world's fourth-largest food crop, following rice, wheat, and maize. Potatoes are a good source of several vitamins and minerals, particularly vitamin C and potassium. They are a staple food in many parts of the world and can be prepared in a variety of ways, including boiling, baking, frying, and mashing.

name: Carrot
description: The carrot is a root vegetable, usually orange in color, though purple, black, red, white, and yellow cultivars exist. Carrots are a good source of several vitamins and minerals, especially vitamin A (from beta-carotene), biotin, vitamin K1, potassium, and vitamin B6. They are crunchy and sweet when eaten fresh, and can be cooked in various dishes, including soups, stews, and salads.
offer: 15% off on purchase of 2 kg or more

name: Chicken
description: Chicken is the most common type of poultry in the world. It is a major source of protein and is consumed as a primary meat in many parts of the world. Chicken meat is versatile and can be cooked in a variety of ways, including roasting, grilling, frying, and boiling. It is used in a wide range of dishes, from soups and stews to salads and sandwiches.

name: Onion
description: The onion, also known as the bulb onion or common onion, is a vegetable that is the most widely cultivated species of the genus Allium. Onions are low in calories and are a good source of vitamins and minerals, especially vitamin C and potassium. They add flavor to many dishes and are used as a base ingredient in cooking, either raw or cooked. Onions are versatile and can be eaten raw in salads, pickled, grilled, fried, or cooked in various dishes.

name: Orange
description: Oranges are citrus fruits produced by citrus trees. They are a good source of vitamin C and other essential nutrients such as fiber, potassium, and antioxidants. Oranges are known for their sweet and tangy flavor and are commonly consumed fresh or juiced. They are also used in cooking and baking, as well as in the production of various beverages, including orange juice and orange-flavored liqueurs.

name: Fish
description: Fish are aquatic vertebrates that are typically cold-blooded, covered with scales, and equipped with two sets of paired fins and several unpaired fins. They are an important food source for humans and other animals, providing high-quality protein, healthy fats, vitamins, and minerals. Fish can be cooked in various ways, including frying, grilling, baking, and steaming. They are consumed fresh, smoked, or preserved in various forms.

name: Cucumber
description: Cucumbers are a widely cultivated plant in the gourd family, Cucurbitaceae. They are a good source of vitamins and minerals, especially vitamin K and potassium. Cucumbers are low in calories and high in water content, making them a refreshing and hydrating snack. They are often eaten raw in salads, sandwiches, and dips, but can also be pickled, cooked, or juiced.

name: Beef
description: Beef is the culinary name for meat from cattle, particularly skeletal muscle. Beef is a rich source of high-quality protein, vitamins, and minerals, including iron, zinc, and vitamin B12. It is consumed in various forms, including steak, roasts, ground beef, and burgers. Beef can be cooked in many different ways, including grilling, roasting, frying, and stewing.

name: Lettuce
description: Lettuce is a leafy vegetable commonly used in salads, sandwiches, wraps, and other dishes. It is a good source of vitamins A and K, as well as folate and fiber. Lettuce comes in several varieties, including iceberg, romaine, and leaf lettuce, each with its own flavor and texture. name: Cheese
description: Cheese is a dairy product derived from milk that is produced in a wide range of flavors, textures, and forms by coagulation of the milk protein casein. It is a good source of calcium, protein, and fat. Cheese is used in cooking and baking, as well as eaten on its own as a snack or appetizer. It is a versatile ingredient that adds flavor and richness to many dishes, including pasta, sandwiches, and salads.

name: Pineapple

Pineapples have a sweet and tangy flavor and can be eaten fresh, juiced, or cooked in various dishes, including desserts, salads, and main courses.

name: Spinach

description: Green beans, also known as string beans or snap beans, are the unripe fruit and protective pods of various cultivars of the common bean.
